intro: Pseudabutilon nigripunctulatum, commonly known as the black-spotted abutilon, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy, bell-shaped flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often cultivated as an ornamental plant. Its unique appearance and adaptability make it a notable species in botanical gardens and tropical landscapes.
